Siconos Installation Guide

Prerequisite

Required libraries

ATLAS (Automatically Tuned Linear Algebra Software).

On most Linuxes this package is available as pre-compiled binary under the name atlas. You also need atlas-devel to include some required header files.
Atlas usually comes with Blas (Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms) and Lapack (Linear Algebra PACKage).

On Fedora: yum install atlas atlas-devel

About Blas: http://www.netlib.org/blas/

About Lapack: http://www.netlib.org/lapack/

About Atlas: http://math-atlas.sourceforge.net/

libxml2

The XML C parser and toolkit. Required for XML file reading and writing.

Usually available as rpm or pre-compiled binaries.

About libxml2: http://xmlsoft.org/

Boost

Boost provides a lot of useful C++ binaries, especially Ublas, a C++ template class library that provides BLAS level 1, 2, 3 functionality for dense, packed and sparse matrices.

Ublas is used in Siconos for matrices and vectors definition and implementation.

Install:

  1. Download Boost at http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=7586
  2. Download bjam. The recommended way to get Boost.Jam if you are using a Boost distribution is to download a pre-built executable from http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=7586&package_id=72941.
  3. Type in the Boost directory: /the/path/of/BOOST-JAM/bjam install (as root)

About Boost: http://www.boost.org/

About Ublas: http://www.boost.org/libs/numeric/ublas/doc/index.htm

Optional libraries

cppunit

CppUnit is a C++ unit testing framework, necessary in Siconos in you want to run tests (make check).

About cppunit: http://cppunit.sourceforge.net/

Scilab

Scilab is an open source platform for numerical computation, used in Front-End package.

Download : http://www.scilab.org/download/index_download.php?page=releasecandidate.html
About scilab: http://www.scilab.org/en/

Python

Python® is a dynamic object-oriented programming language, used in Front-End package.

About Python; http://www.python.org/

The Numeric package for Python is available on Gforge, https://gforge.inria.fr/frs/?group_id=9.

You also need Swig, a software development tool that connects programs written in C and C++ with Python.

About swig: http://www.swig.org/

Doxygen

Doxygen is a documentation system for C++, C, Java, Objective-C, Python, IDL (Corba and Microsoft flavors) and to some extent PHP, C#, and D.
It is used to generate documentation for Siconos files.

You may also need qt, graphviz ... See http://www.stack.nl/~dimitri/doxygen/install.html for details.

Platforms

Siconos v1.3.0 has been successfully compiled on Linux Fedora Core 4 (gcc4.x)

For:

  • Mac OS X: the compilation has not been fully tested and may failed ...

  • Windows: not available at the time, but we would be really grateful for any contribution!

If you have compiled Siconos on another platform successfully, then the maintainer would be glad to hear about that.

External libraries versions

Here is a list of the (recommended) version of the various external libraries used to compile Siconos (on Fedora Core 4)

Autotools:

  • libtool 1.5.22
  • autoconf 2.60
  • automake 1.10

Compiler: gcc 4.0.2

Boost 1.33.1

cppunit: 1.10.2 (warning: it seems that higher versions lead to bugs ...)

Python: 2.4.3

Doxygen: 1.5.1
